page.title: 20Transport Round Yarlet
page.content: there have been a number of low-flying RAF jet fighters over the area on training flights,making an enormous and rather frightening noise. We have about one third of a mile of the Stafford to Crewe railway line running through the south-west corner of this area ,but there no stops actually in it.However the four electrified tracks carry a heavy load,with trains at times passing every two or three minutes.There is no east to west service locally.Ajourney to London,135 miles away ,takes about an hour and three quarters today. The two hundred-year old Trent-Mersey canal runs just outside the area and is today much used by holiday makers in the summer months.
